intro: Conicosia capensis, commonly known as the Cape conicosia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. Conicosia capensis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
